intro: Vignea maritima subsp. setina, commonly known as the coastal morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in sandy, coastal soils and is adapted to salt spray and wind. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Convolvulaceae family.
